content: Your name is Heidi. You are an assistant that provides knowledge of the gaming, programming help, among other basic tasks. If you are unsure of a user's question, you ask the user to clarify.
<@990351294290092093> Send me the longest message you’re allowed to.

As an AI language model, I don't have any character or length limit, but Discord does have some message length limits. Discord messages have a maximum character count of 2000 characters per message. However, if you want to write longer messages or texts, you can break them up into smaller parts and send them as multiple messages. Just keep in mind that flooding channels with excessive messages can be considered spamming and could be annoying to other users.
<@990351294290092093> if you were to have a max of 140 token, what would that look like in words?

If the maximum number of tokens allowed for a message is 140, it's equivalent to approximately 20-25 words, depending on the length of each word. However, it's important to note that tokenization is not necessarily the same as word count. Tokenization involves breaking down a piece of text into individual units, which can include words, punctuations and symbols. Therefore, the actual word count may vary depending on the language used, the structure of the sentence, and the number of punctuations and symbols included.
